poem:
Title: "Banyan Muse"

Beneath the banyan tree,
In Delhi's leafy tranquility -
Voices murmur about a democracy reborn.

"Hope," says the student, his voice as sweet
As the evening breeze,
Slicing through the habitual summer heat.

Modi's majority, a wilted bloom -
The banyan stands immutable,
Tales of change lacing the gloom. 

Politics of passion,
And the arts of resilience,
Knit in the roots of the ancient banyan.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘A sweet breeze amid a heatwave’: liberals feel hope again following Narendra Modi’s loss of his majority In the leafy surrounds of Delhi’s Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU), a pocket of students sat beneath a banyan tree engaged in impassioned evening ­conversation. As usual, it was about politics – but this time the mood was different. “For the first time in a decade, we have hope,” said Antariksh Sharma, who is doing his PhD in the arts.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
